title: 111_s3733
content: The "Achievement Through Prevention Act" aims to enhance student academic achievement, reduce overidentification of individuals with disabilities, and address disciplinary issues in schools through the use of positive behavioral interventions and supports. This Act also includes amendments to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The "Achievement Through Prevention Act" enhances student academic achievement and addresses disciplinary issues in schools through positive behavioral interventions and supports. Amendments to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 include requirements for State Plans to support these interventions. The State Plan under the "Achievement Through Prevention Act" must include provisions for early intervening services to reduce the need for labeling children as disabled. It should also outline how the State will assist local educational agencies in implementing these services, provide training for coordination with similar services under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act, and evaluate the effects of early intervening services. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include reporting on the implementation of positive behavioral interventions and supports, as well as the number of students receiving early intervening services and transitioning to special education. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include reporting on the implementation of positive behavioral interventions and supports under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. The local educational agency must describe actions for providing early intervening services and coordinating them with similar services under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. Additionally, Title I Schoolwide Programs now include implementation of positive behavioral interventions and supports, in coordination with activities under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. The curr_chunk discusses the implementation of early intervening services under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act to improve academic outcomes and reduce disciplinary actions. It also includes technical assistance provisions under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The curr_chunk discusses amendments to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 related to school improvement plans, including the implementation of positive behavior supports to reduce disciplinary actions. The amendments to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 include specifying the adoption of policies for positive behavioral interventions, enhancing coordination with activities under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act, and implementing early intervening services. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include improving positive behavioral interventions, expanding early intervening services, and enhancing coordination with activities under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include improving positive behavioral interventions and supports aligned with activities under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include reviewing and analyzing schools' efforts in identifying and assisting students with poor academic achievement, disabilities, and behavioral problems. It also aims to develop or improve early intervening services and positive behavioral interventions that align with the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include providing information to school personnel, students, and parents about the school's use of positive behavioral interventions and supports. This aims to support a safe learning environment for all students and coordinate the use of early intervening services. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to provide technical assistance for implementing positive behavior interventions and supports, as well as early intervening services to improve academic achievement and reduce disciplinary actions. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to provide technical assistance for implementing positive behavior interventions and supports, as well as early intervening services to improve academic achievement and reduce disciplinary actions. "Intervening services" refers to early intervening services under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act.
